alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Carroll; Cheshire; Grafton; Hillsborough; Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 28 at 1:33PM EDT until June 28 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Flood Advisory for... Southeastern Grafton County in northern New Hampshire... Eastern Cheshire County in southern New Hampshire... Northwestern Hillsborough County in southern New Hampshire... Northwestern Belknap County in central New Hampshire... Central Merrimack County in central New Hampshire... West central Carroll County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 132 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms and showers. This will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to one and half inches of rain has already fallen. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Concord, Laconia, Franklin, Henniker, Plymouth, Meredith, Peterborough, Hopkinton, New Boston, Antrim, Mont Vernon, Canterbury, Holderness, Ashland, Greenfield, Lyndeborough, Bradford, Dublin, Francestown and Bennington. Additional rainfall of half an inch is expected over the area over the next hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

area.areaDesc: Belknap; Carroll; Cheshire; Grafton; Hillsborough; Merrimack
